ca.ualberta.cs.cmput301t02project.view

Class CommentListAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
      • ca.ualberta.cs.cmput301t02project.view.CommentListAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class CommentListAdapter
extends 
implements java.util.Observer
    CommentListAdapter is a subclass of ArrayAdapter. It is considered a view under MVC. CommentListAdapter implements sorting functionality and is called on by either an activity, to change sorting method, or by its model, to update the view and/or resort the list due to changes to the model.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommentListAdapter

        public CommentListAdapter(Context context,
                  int resource,
                  ca.ualberta.cs.cmput301t02project.model.CommentListModel model)
        Constructs a new instance of ArrayAdapter

        The constructor is adapted from the original ArrayAdapter<> constructor, using the same inputs and calling super() with those inputs. The changes are made with the instantiation of the comparators for sortByDate and sortByLocation. These comparators are used to sort the ArrayList that is within the model this adapter displays.

        Parameters:
        context - The current context of the application
        resource - The resource ID for the layout file containing the ListView to use
        model - Objects to represent in the ListView

      • sortByDefaultMethod

        public void sortByDefaultMethod()
        Sorts the ArrayList within model using the default method.

        The default method of sorting uses a combination of date sorting and location sorting. This is done by sorting comments into distance categories based on how far away the user is from the distance category, and then sorting these categories by date.

        The current list is obtained from the model. It is then subjected to serveral for loops which determine which comments are in which distance category. These comments are added to list2, which is sorted by date after each for loop, added to finalList, and then cleared before the next for loop. Once the method has been through all the for loops, it clears the comments currently in list and adds the sorted list of comments contained in finalList.

      • sortByDefault

        public void sortByDefault()
        Sets the sortMethod string to Default.

        This allows sortList to know that the list should be sorted by Default when called.

      • sortByDate

        public void sortByDate()

        public void sortByFaves()

      • sortList

        public void sortList()
        Sorts the list by the method currently set in sortMethod.

        The method checks to see if a model is currently associated with the adapter and then checks to see which sortMethod is currently selected. After determining how to sort, it either uses the comparator for that sorting type to sort the list using the Collections.sort() method or calls the method responsible for that sort type. After the sort is complete, it calls the notifyDataSetChanged() method on the adapter in order to update the view.
